pattern.name: Time KSP
pattern.description:
This pattern converts date into a continuous number (which is an interval measure). Hence, the result is processable with machines. But the number still retains a more-or-less readable form (e.g. in comparison to UNIX time).
Reference: Introduction to Data Mining for the Life Sciences (Rob Sullivan)
Note: To determine, whether a given year is a leap year, the query asks the database for December 31. Note: Does not work for PostgreSQL.
pattern.author: Matej Polak
pattern.code: SELECT @base , YEAR(@temporalColumn) + ((DAYOFYEAR(@temporalColumn) - 0.5) / DAYOFYEAR( CONCAT( YEAR (@temporalColumn), '-12-31' ))) AS @columnName FROM @propagatedTable
